column1: Table 1: Project Efficiency using People Benefitted Scoring Criteria
Criteria
Greater than $77,000/person   1
Less than $6,000/person   10
Table 2: Project Efficiency using Structures Benefitted Scoring Criteria
Criteria
Greater than $261,000/structure   1
$23,000 to $60,000/structure   8
Less than $23,000/structure   10
Table 3: Existing Conditions Scoring Criteria (Channel and Detention Projects)
Criteria
System capacity is > 1% AEP storm (100-year storm)
System capacity is < 1% AEP storm (100-year storm)
System capacity is < 2% AEP storm (50-year storm)  2
System capacity is < 4% AEP storm (25-year storm)  4
System capacity is < 10% AEP storm (10-year storm)
System capacity is < 20% AEP storm (5-year storm)  8
System capacity is < 50% AEP storm (2-year storm)  10
Table 4: Existing Conditions Scoring Criteria (Subdivision Drainage Improvement Projects)
Criteria
Low estimated excess rainfall AND high-quality drainage infrastructure
Intermediate estimated excess rainfall OR medium-quality drainage infrastructure (but not both)
Intermediate estimated excess rainfall AND medium-quality drainage infrastructure
High estimated excess rainfall OR low-quality drainage infrastructure (but not both)
High estimated excess rainfall AND low-quality drainage infrastructure
Table 5: Social Vulnerability Scoring Criteria
Criteria
SVI indicates low level of vulnerability
SVI indicates low to moderate level of vulnerability
SVI indicates moderate to high level of vulnerability
SVI indicates high level of vulnerability
Table 6: Long Term Maintenance Costs Scoring Criteria
Criteria
Project will require extensive or specialized maintenance
Project will require maintenance outside of District's or jurisdiction’s regular maintenance practices
Project only requires regular, on-going maintenance
Table 7: Minimize Environmental Impacts Scoring Criteria (Channel and Detention Projects)
Criteria
Project will have significant environmental impacts requiring a Corps of Engineers Individual Permit and mitigation bank credits
Project will have significant environmental impacts requiring mitigation bank credits
Project is able to significantly avoid environmental impacts
Project has minimal or no environmental impacts
Table 8: Minimize Environmental Impacts Scoring Criteria (Subdivision Drainage Improvement Projects)
Criteria
Project will require acquiring additional right-of-way
Project can be completed within the road’s existing right-of-way
Table 9: Potential for Multiple Benefits Scoring Criteria (Channel and Detention Projects)
Criteria
Project does not have multiple benefits
Project has recreational benefits
Project has environmental enhancement benefits
Project has recreational and environmental enhancement benefits
Table 10: Potential for Multiple Benefits Scoring Criteria (Subdivision Drainage Improvement Projects)
Criteria
Project area does not benefit from a District improvement such as a nearby channel improvement or detention basin project
Project area also benefits from a District improvement such as a nearby channel improvement or detention basin project
